evidence.text: Person B: No. Bedtime. And Marcelo, the dog goes in the garage.
Person B: Come have lunch, sweetie.

Person A: He went out. Let's go to your room.
Person A: Calm down, honey. It'll be okay. Just don't tell the little ones. They don't know what's going on.

Person A: They're armed, Mom.
Person B: I know.
Person A: Can I sleep in your bed?
Person B: Best stay with your sisters.

Person B: Not yet. They want to ask us some questions.
Person B: Yes, sweetie. But don't worry, we'll be back soon. 
Person B: C'mon, get dressed. 
Person B: Stay with the children, please.

Person A: Mom? 
Person B: Honey, are you all right?

Person A: Don't cry, honey. 
Person A: Did they do anything to you?

Person B: Mom, no. They said not to use the phone. C'mon, I'll go with you.
Person B: But I want to know what's happening, why Dad still hasn't--

Person A: No, Eliana. You have to go to school. 
Person A: -Go get ready for school, honey.
Person B: I don't feel like practicing.
Person B: I miss the beach, the soufflé, and you all. I miss everything, Vera.

Person A: You skipped the part about Dad and me--
Person B: -Enough, Eliana. Give it to me.
Person B: We're going back to São Paulo.
Person B: I know it's hard to understand, but you'll just have to be patient. This process is--

Person B: This house is already rented out. It's going to become a restaurant. I want each of you to pack your things, and on Friday, a moving truck will pull up out front. 
Person B: Pass the rice, Marcelo.
